page.title: 11 The Hamlet Knighton
page.content: Knighton is a small hamlet situated near Inkberrow. Fifty years ago all of the land was owned by the Lord of Abergovenny and was one big farm.Oxen and horses were used to plough the land instead of tractors.Then the Lord of Abergovenny sold the land to the Marquis of Hertford,and it was then split into a few small farms. If a family wanted to move to Knighton then,they would have to build their own farm house or bungalow.The people building their homes often used stones from Ragley mill.Fifty years ago to get to the shops,the people had to walk across the fields to the neighbouring town for food.Nowadays there is a bus service,but it only runs once a week. There are a few local activities such as deer hunting and occasional fetes.
